List of ambassadors of the United Kingdom to the Netherlands

response: Lord Chichester married, in 1861, Elizabeth Mary Bligh, only daughter of the Hon. Sir John Duncan Bligh. They had no children. He died at his residence Stanmer House on 28 May 1902, aged 63, and is buried in Stanmer churchyard. He was succeeded in his titles by his younger brother Reverend Francis Pelham. Lady Chichester died in December 1911, aged 74.
*Hon. Sir John Duncan Bligh (1798–1872), a diplomat in Sweden and Hanover

response: * John Duncan Bligh (1798–1872), his son, British envoy to Sweden and Hanover

|Played in 24 first-class matches, mainly for Kent and MCC. Father of John Duncan Bligh and brother of the Hon. Edward Bligh and part of the Darnley family which was later influential in the development of Kent County Cricket Club.
